label: UI Lights
info:
Controls the ETC colorsource console.

See [here](https://support.etcconnect.com/ETC/Consoles/ColorSource/ColorSource_20_and_40_AV/OSC_Commands_for_ColorSource_AV_Console) for the command reference

The ultimate goal is to be able to read a list of cues from the console, and be able to fire the cues from the node-red UI.

label: UI Hyperdeck
info:
This flow has a few main functions ,all associated with recording both audio and visual media.

 * Set the file name on both video recorders. The filenames are to include the song title, take number, and card number. 
 * Increment the take number everytime "record" is pushed (with the same song name) - not yet implemented
 * Announce the song and take info on the audio output
 * Display the song and take info as a message on the ProPresenter Stage Display.

label: UI Projectors
info:
Basic function is to turn the configured projectors on and off.

It also displays the current projector status.

label: UI Cameras
info:
Basic function is to switch the cameras on and off. 

Ultimately I hope to link the tally functions of the BMD ATEM to the cameras.

See [here for details](https://www.sony.net/Products/CameraSystem/CA/BRC_X1000_BRC_H800/Technical_Document/C456100121.pdf)

input is a space delimited list of hex codes, result is bytes of that value

example: input "FF FF", output b'\xFF\xFF'

# This is a snippet of Python code for command formatting.

def compose(s):
    parsed = s.split(" ")
    glued  = "".join(parsed)
    bs = bytes.fromhex(glued)
    return(bs)

 - "poweron"
 -- compose('01 00 00 06 00 00 00 02 81 01 04 00 02 FF')
 - "poweroff"
 -- compose('01 00 00 06 00 00 00 02 81 01 04 00 03 FF')
 - "powerinq"          : 
 -- compose('01 00 00 05 00 00 00 01 81 09 04 00 FF')
 - "home"              : 
 -- compose('01 00 00 05 00 00 00 01 81 01 06 04 FF'),
 - "camzoomtele"
 -- compose('01 00 00 06 00 00 00 01 81 01 04 07 02 FF')
 - "camzoomwide"
 -- compose('01 00 00 06 00 00 00 01 81 01 04 07 03 FF')  
 - "command_completed"
 -- compose('90 50 FF') # expected result

# Tally commands

 - On/Off Inquiry 
 - 8x 09 7E 01 0A FF y0 50 0p FF 
 - p: 2=On, 3=Off

label: UI ProPresenter
info:
Basic control of ProPresenter 6.

# Based on this web page

https://github.com/jeffmikels/ProPresenter-API/blob/master/Pro6.md

label: UI ATEM
info:
The main communication engine is provided by
[this](https://github.com/haydendonald/blackmagic-atem-nodered/blob/master/howToUse.md)

This relies heavily on 
[this](https://www.skaarhoj.com/fileadmin/BMDPROTOCOL.html)

label: UI Planning Centre
info: Intergration with Planning centre

label: UI Video Matrix
info:
Controls for the Kramer VS-88DT 8x8 video matrix. 
This device implements the Kramer "3000" protocol which is documented [here](https://k.kramerav.com/downloads/protocols/protocol_3000_3.0_master_user.pdf).

Asset Tag ZVKUA001
 
IP 192.168.0.184

label: UI Playground
info:
One possible future addition would be dante control. or at least R/O access to the dante config. Resources: 
 - https://www.gearslutz.com/board/music-computers/1221989-dante-routing-without-dante-controller-possible.html

label: ICM
info:
Internet Connection Monitor

Periodically ping an internet website and log the result.

name: Input Listing
format:
In # Connected Device
1 Triple Wide "A" (East)
2 Triple Wide "B" (Centre)
3 Triple Wide "C" (West)
4 Stage Display
5 CDWU-0009
6 ?ATEM Program
7 ?ATEM Aux
8 Light Console

label: ATEM Pgm -> Prj A & C
tooltip: Video Mixer Program output to East and West Screens

label: ATEM Aux -> Prj B
tooltip: ATEM Aux output to Centre Screen

rules.v: (	   msg.payload.out1 > 0 and msg.payload.out1 < 9	) and (	   msg.payload.out2 > 0 and msg.payload.out2 < 9	) and (	   msg.payload.out3 > 0 and msg.payload.out3 < 9	) and (	   msg.payload.out4 > 0 and msg.payload.out4 < 9	) and (	   msg.payload.out5 > 0 and msg.payload.out5 < 9	) and (	   msg.payload.out6 > 0 and msg.payload.out6 < 9	) and  (	   msg.payload.out7 > 0 and msg.payload.out7 < 9	) and  (	   msg.payload.out8 > 0 and msg.payload.out8 < 9	)

name: Things on this page are experimental.
save to flow context
Retrieve from flow and format
func:
off_colour = "#FF0000";
on_colour  = "#00FF00";

msg = { "payload": [  
              {"projector":  "1",
                "name":      flow.get("ps_1_name"),
                "lamp":      flow.get("ps_1_lamp"),
                "power":     flow.get("ps_1_power"),
                "input":     flow.get("ps_1_input"),
                "powercolour": (flow.get("ps_1_power") == "Off" ? off_colour : on_colour) 
              } ,
              {"projector":  "2",
                "name":      flow.get("ps_2_name"),
                "lamp":      flow.get("ps_2_lamp"),                 
                "power":     flow.get("ps_2_power"),
                "input":     flow.get("ps_2_input"),                
                "powercolour": (flow.get("ps_2_power") == "Off" ? off_colour : on_colour)
              } ,
               {"projector":  "3",
                "name":      flow.get("ps_3_name"),
                "lamp":      flow.get("ps_3_lamp"),
                "power":     flow.get("ps_3_power"),
                "input":     flow.get("ps_3_input"),
                "powercolour": (flow.get("ps_3_power") == "Off" ? off_colour : on_colour)
              }
]
}

return  msg ;
